HDG.IM.content: many (essential) words [transcendental signifier] are worn out, used up, abused—language in general is used up, masterless, as indifferent as means of public transportation [social media]

HDG.BC.content: true/wakeful youth has prerogative to develop exhortations to knowledge from out of itself [?] > can the American man know what “reading” means? [w/ all his “newspapers,” social media] > awaken/keep awake binding power of spirit/bindingness of essential

HDG.WM.content: turn away from nothing into beings: hasten into public superficies of our existence > what testifies (zeugt) to manifestation (Offenbarkeit) of nothing in our existence more than negation? > “not (das Nicht)” more original [?] than negation, negating only one way of nihilating (one way of comporting grounded beforehand in in nihilation of nothing) [annihilation is another way?] > “not” becomes manifest only when nihilation of nothing disengaged from concealment: idea of “logic” disintegrates in turbulence of more originary questioning [has this been proven?]
HDG.WM.linkedContent: turn away from nothing into beings: hasten into public superficies of our existence > what testifies (zeugt) to manifestation (Offenbarkeit) of nothing in our existence more than negation? > “not (das Nicht)” more original [?] than negation, negating only one way of nihilating (one way of comporting grounded beforehand in in nihilation of nothing) [annihilation is another way?] > “not” becomes manifest only when nihilation of nothing disengaged from concealment: idea of “logic” disintegrates in turbulence of more originary questioning [has this been proven?]

HDG.FS.content: Heidegger learned from Hölderlin uselessness of coining new words > information technology robbing language of its proper laws, mere instrument (Werkzeug) of information > [Heideggerian imperative] “untiringly work outside of all publicness (Öffentlichkeit) to keep alive (lebendig zu bewahren) a thinking that is attentive to being (ein dem Sein achtsames Denken)”: lay foundation (begründen) for distant future (ferne Zukunft), possibility of tradition (Überlieferung) [to come, arrival?]

HDG.FS.content: Marxism as a whole rests on this thesis [from Early Writings]: “to be radical is to grasp the root of the matter, but for man the root is man himself,” thinks on the basis of production: social production of society, self-production of human being as social being > Marxism is thought of today, where self-production of man & society prevail [isn’t Nietzsche & Hegel also thought of today?] > self-production (Selbstherstellung) raises danger (Gefahr) of self-destruction (Selbstzerstörung)

HDG.MA.content: [Derrida beyond Heidegger] [Heidegger describes the homelessness of those who watch Television, listen to radio, go to movies] the rootedness (Bodenständigkeit), the autochthony, of man threatened today at its core: loss of autochthony springs from spirit of age in which we were born: the atomic age (atom bomb: its most conspicuous symbol)

HDG.DL.content: [back to path of question of hermeneutics] hermeneutics als Beiwort to “phenomenology,” means the interpretation itself [not hermeneutics usual meaning] > explaining etymology of hermeneutics will help clarify Heidegger’s intention (Absicht) w/ experiment (Versuch) of phenomenology > Japaner points out Heidegger has now dropped both words [along his path] > not done to deny phenomenology, but to abandon (lassen) my path of thinking to namelessness > which can’t be successful > because public requires rubric (Titel)
HDG.DL.linkedContent: [back to path of question of hermeneutics] hermeneutics als Beiwort to “phenomenology,” means the interpretation itself [not hermeneutics usual meaning] > explaining etymology of hermeneutics will help clarify Heidegger’s intention (Absicht) w/ experiment (Versuch) of phenomenology > Japaner points out Heidegger has now dropped both words [along his path] > not done to deny phenomenology, but to abandon (lassen) my path of thinking to namelessness > which can’t be successful > because public requires rubric (Titel)

HDG.DL.content: [Heidegger doesn’t want to publish lecture “Logos”? transcripts would distort its saying—anti-supplement?]
HDG.DL.linkedContent: [Heidegger doesn’t want to publish lecture “Logos”? transcripts would distort its saying—anti-supplement?]

HDG.LP.content: is [all] this dreamy romanticism of modern world (technology, economics) or clear knowledge of “madman”? he who sees more than what’s in the latest news, the current happenings [social media]

HDG.LP.content: [program] all formulas are dangerous: force what’s said into superficiality (Äusserlichkeit) of instant opinion (raschen Meninens), can corrupt thinking > but can also prompt sustained reflection
HDG.LP.linkedContent: [program] all formulas are dangerous: force what’s said into superficiality (Äusserlichkeit) of instant opinion (raschen Meninens), can corrupt thinking > but can also prompt sustained reflection

HDG.EC.content: referring to evil I see better how we can encounter devastation, that we cannot encounter devastation > must think devastation more rigorously > since devastation is not moral badness (Schlechtigkeit), moral indignation (moralische Entrüstung), even if it makes general public (Weltöffentlichkeit) its mouthpiece, can’t do anything against devastation > moral superiority (Überlegenheit) in no position to grasp, much less abolish (aufzuheben)/mitigate evil

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.EC.linkedContent: referring to evil I see better how we can encounter devastation, that we cannot encounter devastation > must think devastation more rigorously > since devastation is not moral badness (Schlechtigkeit), moral indignation (moralische Entrüstung), even if it makes general public (Weltöffentlichkeit) its mouthpiece, can’t do anything against devastation > moral superiority (Überlegenheit) in no position to grasp, much less abolish (aufzuheben)/mitigate evil

HDG.EC.content: could be that morality, w/ its visions of world order, is a monstrous offspring (Ausgeburt) of evil, & the much-appealed-to (vielberufene) Weltöffentlichkeit (word’s general public) remains in essence a construct (Gebild) and product (Erzeugnis) of devastation

HDG.OHF.content: everything modern steals away from its own time (industry, propaganda, creating “effect” only in fashion) > Dasein encounters itself, its Seinscharakter, not a matter for universal humanity or a public, but, in each case (je), definite/decisive possibility of concrete facticity

HDG.OHF.content: grasp facticity w/ view to primordiality followed to the end > must be wide awake for specific categories of Dasein, must be brought into view in public manner (having-been-interpreted in the today)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: grasp facticity w/ view to primordiality followed to the end > must be wide awake for specific categories of Dasein, must be brought into view in public manner (having-been-interpreted in the today)

HDG.OHF.content: as open space of publicness, nothing eludes the talk: averageness (Durchschnittlichkeit), discusses everything w/ insensitivity to difference (Unterschiedsunempfindlichkeit) > Öffentlichkeit as being of “Man (every-one)”: everyone says that, everyone expects that, talk in circulation belongs to no one [Irigaray] > “Man” = “Niemand” > Dasein haunted like a specter by this circulation, a how of factical life that pays tribute to the fateful undoing (Verhängnisses) of facticity

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

motif.name: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]
motif.title: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]

HDG.OHF.content: [method, quasi-destruction: we must kneed out ontological access to facticity from the initial public givens of being-interpreted, from average talk]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [method, quasi-destruction: we must kneed out ontological access to facticity from the initial public givens of being-interpreted, from average talk]

HDG.OHF.content: phenomenology can only be appropriated (zugeeignet) phenomenologically, i.e. through demonstration (Ausweisung), & not by repeating Grundsätze or following Schuldogmen > we’re constantly deceived about things in themselves: once the conscience of philosophy, “now a pimp (Zuhälterin) for the public whoring of the mind (öffentlichen Hurerei des Geistes), fornicatio spiritus” (Luther)

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: phenomenology can only be appropriated (zugeeignet) phenomenologically, i.e. through demonstration (Ausweisung), & not by repeating Grundsätze or following Schuldogmen > we’re constantly deceived about things in themselves: once the conscience of philosophy, “now a pimp (Zuhälterin) for the public whoring of the mind (öffentlichen Hurerei des Geistes), fornicatio spiritus” (Luther)

HDG.OHF.content: “tarrying among (Verweilen bei)” sustains possibility of actualizing a universal classifying that compares [historical] forms, in it lies relational guarantee that every past culture can be encountered objectively > a constant seeing this & that, can never halt [cf. 45 abode-less tarrying (das aufenthaltslose Verweilen) that holds itself/sojourns in (Aufhalten) what it returns to) > what’s encountered in this Verweilen as universal possibility of expression, divided into unities of style: beings in the How of their having-being, already there [for us to see] (i.e. past is available, is a past present, not our virtuality) > a pull (Zug) arises from the already there (schon da) in the past: world, life, publicness, what was going on [if destruction occurs by thinking Zug outside of Zug of historical consciousness, deconstruction occurs by noting that Zug of historical consciousness never occurs, i.e that everyday facticity has been overdetermined, we were never that close to it]

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.OHF.content: being everywhere & nowhere of philosophical knowing: an absolute curiosity (Neugier) [Heidegger then describes something close to idle talk, how philosophy is public, has an autonomous curiosity, gives itself a foothold in life, thus preserving itself]

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: being everywhere & nowhere of philosophical knowing: an absolute curiosity (Neugier) [Heidegger then describes something close to idle talk, how philosophy is public, has an autonomous curiosity, gives itself a foothold in life, thus preserving itself]

HDG.OHF.content: [why phenomenology requires destruction] in any discipline, we’re face to face w/ how things stand at the moment [i.e. how the public world views them] > their showing-themselves (Sich-zeigen) can be so restricted/fixed (festgelegt) by tradition, the inauthenticity goes unnoticed, taken for authentic: one passes off a contingency (Zufälligkeit) as an in-itself, takes a covering up (Verdeckung) for Sache itself > need to get beyond position started from (Anfangsstellung) & arrive at grasp of subject matter free of covering up (zur verdeckungsfreien Sacherfassung zu kommen) > the tradition must be dismantled (abgebaut)

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [why phenomenology requires destruction] in any discipline, we’re face to face w/ how things stand at the moment [i.e. how the public world views them] > their showing-themselves (Sich-zeigen) can be so restricted/fixed (festgelegt) by tradition, the inauthenticity goes unnoticed, taken for authentic: one passes off a contingency (Zufälligkeit) as an in-itself, takes a covering up (Verdeckung) for Sache itself > need to get beyond position started from (Anfangsstellung) & arrive at grasp of subject matter free of covering up (zur verdeckungsfreien Sacherfassung zu kommen) > the tradition must be dismantled (abgebaut)

HDG.OHF.content: uncovering essential laws (Wesensgesetze entdecken)! “horrid wretchedness (grausende Elend) of such systematic seduction of our fellow human beings” > passing off presuppositions as harmless by means of formalizing rationalization, bringing them to Public as such
